intro: Randia talangninia, commonly known as the Malayan randia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
